intro: Carex hebes, commonly known as the slender sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to various regions in the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, stream sides, and wet meadows. It has grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Carex hebes is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
